name: Red
description: Red personalities are direct, results-focused, and decisive. They thrive on taking action, solving problems quickly, and driving outcomes. They value efficiency, clear goals, and tangible results.
behavioral_examples: Makes quick decisions and moves forward without hesitation
Prefers direct communication and getting to the point
Focuses on outcomes and measurable results
Takes charge in ambiguous or crisis situations
Values speed and efficiency over consensus
strengths: Decisive leadership in high-pressure situations
Ability to cut through complexity and focus on what matters
Strong drive to achieve tangible results
Comfortable taking calculated risks
Natural problem-solver who takes initiative
stress_pattern: May become overly controlling or impatient when needs aren't met; can push too hard for results without considering team dynamics

name: Green
description: Green personalities are logical, systematic, and detail-oriented. They excel at analyzing information, solving complex problems, and ensuring accuracy. They value data, expertise, and thorough understanding.
behavioral_examples: Analyzes situations thoroughly before making decisions
Seeks data and evidence to support conclusions
Prefers working independently on complex problems
Values accuracy, precision, and technical expertise
Takes time to understand systems and processes deeply
strengths: Exceptional analytical and critical thinking skills
High attention to detail and quality standards
Ability to see patterns and logical connections
Strong technical expertise in their domain
Thorough research and problem-solving approach
stress_pattern: May become overly critical or perfectionistic when stressed; can get lost in details and analysis paralysis

name: Yellow
description: Yellow personalities are outgoing, optimistic, and relationship-focused. They thrive on social interaction, collaboration, and creating positive energy. They value teamwork, recognition, and shared success.
behavioral_examples: Energizes groups with enthusiasm and positivity
Builds relationships quickly and naturally
Prefers collaborative work over solo tasks
Seeks recognition and appreciation from others
Creates fun and engaging work environments
strengths: Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to motivate and inspire teams
Natural networking and relationship-building
Creates positive, inclusive team culture
Adaptable and open to new ideas and people
stress_pattern: May avoid conflict or difficult conversations; can become overly concerned with others' opinions and need excessive validation

name: Blue
description: Blue personalities are calm, dependable, and service-oriented. They excel at supporting others, maintaining harmony, and ensuring processes run smoothly. They value stability, loyalty, and meaningful relationships.
behavioral_examples: Provides steady, reliable support to team members
Listens carefully and shows genuine empathy
Prefers stable, predictable work environments
Values deep, authentic relationships over broad networks
Takes time to build trust and commitment
strengths: Exceptional listening and empathy skills
Reliable and consistent in following through
Creates calm, supportive work environments
Strong loyalty and commitment to team
Patient and thoughtful in decision-making
stress_pattern: May become passive-aggressive or withdrawn when overwhelmed; can struggle with change and may resist necessary confrontation
